title: UK man sentenced for murder after drunkenly telling police 'what happened'
description: Marek Hecko has been sentenced for life in prison with a minimum of 26 years for murdering Adrian Ellingford in Chelmsford, Essex. Footage shows Hecko drunkenly approaching police.

title: New York high school student bullied by teacher: lawsuit
description: Centereach High School student Isabella Moore filed a claim against Middle Country School District in New York, arguing that her teacher bullied her and made racist remarks.

title: Vermont Senate passes bill protecting providers of abortions, trans procedures from legal action
description: The Vermont Senate on Friday passed a bill that would eliminate most legal liabilities for abortion and sex change providers, protecting the procedures under state law.

title: NBA fines Grizzlies' Dillon Brooks $35,000 for shoving camera person to the ground
description: The NBA on Friday announced that Memphis Grizzlies forward Dillon Brooks was fined $35,000 for shoving a camera person during Wednesday night’s game against the Miami Heat.

title: University of Wisconsin budget plan would include 5% tuition hike
description: A proposed budget by University of Wisconsin System President Jay Rothman would call for tuition increases of up to 5.4% for undergraduate students.

title: California lawmaker introduces bill that would require schools to notify parents if their child is transgender
description: A California lawmaker introduced Assembly Bill 1314, which would require school districts to notify parents after learning a student is identifying with

title: St. Mary's uses dominant second half to advance in March Madness over VCU
description: St. Mary's only led by one at halftime, but it took care of business in the second half against VCU to advance to the second round of March Madness.

title: Georgia murder suspect arrested at Niagara Falls border, attempted to cross into Canada: Officials
description: A Georgia man was taken into custody by U.S. Customs and Border Protection while trying to cross the border into Canada on Wednesday, officials said.

title: Arizona Gov. Hobbs to sign order banning hair discrimination
description: The Arizona governor is expected to sign an order that will ban discrimination based on hair. Gov. Katie Hobbs will do the ceremonial signing Friday afternoon.

title: 6 women who went missing in Mexico were killed, bodies burned by armed men
description: Six women who went missing in Mexico were killed, and their bodies were burned by a gang of armed men. The women went missing on March 7, and the motive is still unknown.

title: 3 police dead in Mexico City shootout with cartel gunmen
description: Three police officers died in a Mexico City shootout with gunmen who are suspected drug cartel members. The officers were killed approaching a house where gang members were hiding.

title: Florida woman still missing one week after car broke down in Ocala National Forest: police
description: Florida woman Theresa Hartley, 66, has been missing for over a week after a vehicle she was in broke down. She was last seen near Lake Delancy in the Ocala National Forest.

title: North Carolina student in good condition after being hit by Tesla
description: A North Carolina teen who was struck by a Tesla after getting off a school bus is in good condition after sustaining life-threatening injuries. The driver failed to stop for the bus.

title: Scientists create mice with cells from 2 males for first time
description: By turning male mouse stem cells into female cells in a lab, scientists have created baby mice with two fathers for the first time. About 1% of the mouse embryos grew into pups.

title: Conservative Dan Kelly releases first ad of Wisconsin Supreme Court campaign
description: Conservative Wisconsin Supreme Court candidate Dan Kelly has released his first televised campaign ad two weeks before a consequential election deciding the high court's power balance.

title: Longtime Wisconsin Sec. of State, 'Fighting Bob' relative Doug La Follette resigns post
description: Wisconsin's 11-term Secretary of State, Doug La Follette, has resigned his post to focus on "personal needs," with former Treasurer Sarah Godlewski taking his place.

title: Quadruple murder trial for former New York cop, Epstein cellmate underway
description: Nicholas Tartaglione, a former New York police officer, is standing trial for allegedly killing four men over money in a drug operation before burying them on his property.

title: Oshkosh cop shoots, injures suspect who drove at officers, threatening their life
description: An Oshkosh police officer shot and wounded a suspect who drove a vehicle toward officers while they were conducting an investigation. Officers were responding to a threats complaint.

title: William Shatner loves to use 'juicy' F-word
description: Legendary actor William Shatner of "Star Trek" fame shared his love for the F-word with a crowd at the South by Southwest pop culture festival in Austin, Texas.

title: Tennessee library director fired over ‘unkind pushback’ during Kirk Cameron event
description: Actor and writer Kirk Cameron wrote about 'unking pushback' at the Hendersonville Library in Kentucky prior to library director Allan Morales' termination.

title: NFL's touchdown leader Jamaal Williams says Lions' offer was 'disrespectful'
description: Jamaal Williams rushed for a career-high 17 touchdowns last year, but the Detroit Lions apparently didn't do their best to bring back the running back.

title: Trump says biggest threat to America is not Russia but 'USA-hating people,' including 'godless' Marxists
description: Former President Donald Trump said Thursday in a new video that the biggest threat to the U.S. isn't Russia but rather Americans who hate their own country, including "godless" Marxists.

title: Hunter Biden countersuit against Wilmington computer repairman 'one of the weirdest filings': Turley
description: President Biden's son Hunter Biden filed a countersuit against a former Delaware repair shop owner, and Jonathan Turley reacted on 'The Story.'

title: Oklahoma police captain arrested for DUI, repeatedly begs officer to 'turn your camera off'
description: A captain for the Oklahoma City Police Department was filmed begging for an officer to turn off their bodycam footage after he was pulled over for suspected drink-driving

title: Jets’ Allen Lazard talks with certainty about looming Aaron Rodgers trade
description: Aaron Rodgers wants to play for the New York Jets, but no deal has been made with the Green Bay Packers. Former teammate Allen Lazard, who signed with the Jets Wednesday, thinks otherwise.

title: Latest Twitter Files tackle 'Great Covid-19 Lie Machine' flagging true content as 'disinformation'
description: Independent journalist Matt Taibbi went viral with the newest Twitter Files taking aim at Stanford University's Virality Project that it said was meant to 'mitigate' false narratives.

title: Rick Scott demands answers on NIH funding that went to Wuhan Institute of Virology
description: Florida Sen. Rick Scott is calling for more information on how the National Institutes of Health monitors the flow of its federal grant dollars

title: Wintry weather shutters schools, buildings in parts of New Mexico
description: Winter weather in parts of New Mexico has shut down schools and all city and government buildings. Northern and central parts of the state were covered in snow Friday morning.

title: 'Jurassic Park' star Sam Neill reveals he has 'ferocious' stage 3 cancer
description: "Jurassic Park" star Sam Neill details his stage 3 blood cancer diagnosis in his upcoming memoir. The actor, 75, revealed that he's "possibly dying," but isn't afraid.

title: Charles Barkley claims he used to clean his uniform by showering in it: 'Easier to do it that way'
description: Hall of Famer and TV analyst Charles Barkley said Friday he used to shower in his uniform after games to get it clean when teams would fly commercial.

title: Kentucky appeals court upholds federal conviction of pardoned man
description: A Kentucky appeals court has upheld the federal conviction of a pardoned man. The man's 2014 drug robbery killing conviction was pardoned by Kentucky’s former governor.

title: Democrats call for AOC-endorsed NY lawmaker's resignation over sexual misconduct claims
description: New York Assemblyman Juan Ardila, a freshman Democrat from Queens, is facing calls to resign after two women's accusations of sexual misconduct surfaced.

title: Trump returns to Facebook for first time in years with simple two-word post: 'I'M BACK!'
description: Former President Donald Trump posted on Facebook for the first time Friday after he regained access to his accounts following a two-year ban.

title: Flood deaths in Turkey's earthquake-stricken area rise to 16
description: The death toll due to floods in an earthquake-stricken area of Turkey has risen to 16 after officers found two more bodies. The flash floods are in the provinces of Adiyaman and Sanliurfa.

title: Mexican president says lack of 'hugs and embraces,' not drug cartels, to blame for fentanyl crisis
description: The president of Mexico says "a lack of hugs and embraces" are to blame for the ongoing U.S. fentanyl crisis, which kills tens of thousands of Americans each year.

title: EPA orders states to stop blocking East Palestine waste from storage sites
description: The Environmental Protection Agency on Friday ordered states to stop rejecting contaminated waste from the East Palestine, Ohio, train derailment being sent to their storage facilities.

title: New York man who supported ISIS arrested in alleged plot to kill cops, mayor during St. Patrick’s Day parade
description: A New York man threatened to attack police officers and kill a mayor during a local St. Patrick’s Day parade, authorities said.

title: Nonprofit Oxfam's inclusivity guide calls English the 'language of a colonising nation'
description: British humanitarian organization calls English 'the language of a colonising nation' that must be 'addressed in order to decolonise our ways of working and shift power'

title: YouTube, TikTok and Snapchat sued by Silicon Valley school board for 'monetizing misery'
description: The San Mateo County superintendent and school board filed a lawsuit against YouTube, Snapchat and TikTok, alleging that they created a mental health crisis.

title: Trump calls for 'retribution' against China for role in COVID-19 pandemic
description: Former President Trump on Friday released a campaign video calling for China to face "retribution" for its alleged role in the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Detroit customs officials find 6 live Giant African Snails in suitcase at airport
description: Border officials found six Giant African Snails in the suitcase of a traveler who arrived in Detroit from Africa

title: Jake Paul's coach, former boxer BJ Flores, shot during robbery attempt in Colombia
description: BJ Flores, former boxer turned into full-time coach for Jake Paul, was shot in the leg during a robbery attack while vacationing in Colombia.

title: Happy St. Patrick's Day: Biden jokes he's 'really not Irish' because he's 'never had a drink'
description: President Biden joked about not really being Irish because he doesn't drink at the annual St. Patrick's Day Friends of Ireland Luncheon at the Capitol.

title: Northwest Pakistan house fire kills at least 10 people
description: A northwest Pakistan house fire killed at least 10 people early Friday morning. The people who died, including women and children, were killed by a collapsing roof.

title: Louisiana environmental secretary Chuck Carr Brown resigns
description: Louisiana's environmental secretary Chuck Carr Brown is resigning at the end of this month. Brown has led the department since 2016, and his departure is effective March 31.

title: Helen Mirren shares racy, stripped-down secret
description: Actress Helen Mirren tried to dodge a question about skinny-dipping before offering a cheeky answer on "The Kelly Clarkson Show" on Friday.

title: Ghanaian president attends funeral of soccer player killed in Turkey earthquake
description: Ghanaian President Nana Akufo-Addo was accompanied by numerous current and former government officials at the funeral of soccer star Christian Atsu.

title: Disgraced ex-Minneapolis cop Chauvin pleads guilty in tax evasion case
description: Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin, currently serving an over two-decade sentence for the killing of George Floyd, has pleaded guilty to two tax evasion counts.

title: Colts sign ex-Eagles quarterback Gardner Minshew to one-year deal
description: Gardner Minshew is reuniting with former Eagles offensive coordinator Shane Steichen in Indianapolis after signing a one-year deal with the Colts on Friday, the team announced.

title: How drones are revolutionizing delivery by taking to the skies
description: Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson reveals which companies are using food delivery drones in 2023, from Starbucks to McDonald's, and what it means for the industry's future.

title: Lance Reddick, star of 'The Wire' and the 'John Wick' franchise, dead at 60
description: "The Wire" and "John Wick" star Lance Reddick died "suddenly" on Friday morning. He was 60. His representative Mia Hansen confirmed his death, which she attributed to natural causes.

title: Goldie Hawn wishes Kurt Russell 'Happy Birthday' after he revealed why they never married
description: Goldie Hawn is showing off her partner of 40 years, Kurt Russell, on his 72nd birthday. The couple recently revealed why they decided to never get married.

title: Ohio State University student Henry Meacock dies during spring break
description: Henry Meacock, a finance major at Ohio State University from New Jersey, died during the school’s spring break this week, officials said.

title: Border Patrol agents have stopped migrants from 147 different countries since October
description: The head of U.S. Border Patrol announced that agents have encountered migrants from 147 different countries so far this fiscal year -- with more than 900,000 encounters.

title: Arkansas Snapchat predator sentenced after tracking 13-year-old girl's location through app
description: An Arkansas man used Spanchat to "induce" a 13-year-old girl "to send him nude images and videos of herself, amounting to child pornography under federal law."

title: Bengals' Jonah Williams asks for trade following Orlando Brown signing
description: Jonah Williams was drafted in 2019 draft, and since then he has been the Bengals' starting left tackle, but the addition of Orlando Brown puts Williams' future in doubt.

title: Baylor avoids upset against UC Santa Barbara with big second half
description: The three-seeded Baylor Bears trailed at halftime but were able to run away with a first-round victory over No. 14 UC Santa Barbara on Friday.

title: Los Angeles schools brace for possible shutdown after union announces 3-day strike, demands 'equitable' wages
description: A union representing education workers in California is holding a three-day strike after negotiations broke down with the Los Angeles Unified School District.

title: Nearly 100 people help carry California beached whale to rescue vehicle
description: Nearly 100 California beachgoers helped carry a beached pygmy sperm whale to a rescue vehicle. The whale weighed an estimated 600 to 900 pounds and died during transport.

title: British officer keeps job despite 'gross misconduct' in soccer star's clubbing
description: British police officer Mary Ellen Bettley-Smith was allowed to keep her job after being issued a written warning for illegally beating former soccer pro Dalian Atkinson.

title: Pennsylvania prosecutor jailed after conviction on 6 charges in attack on woman
description: A Pennsylvania prosecutor was jailed after jurors convicted him of six charges in an attack on a woman. Jeffrey L. Thomas had served as Somerset County district attorney.

title: UN rights chief calls for end to 'systematic repression' in Belarus
description: The United Nations rights chief called for an end to "systematic repression" in Belarus, and called for an immediate release of political prisoners.

title: New York investigators probing fire in Chinese billionaire's apartment that broke out hours after arrest
description: NYC fire marshals are looking into the cause of a 2-alarm apartment fire in the luxury Sherry-Netherland Hotel in Manhattan, hours after owner's arrest.

title: Federal government ships 3 mega generators to Puerto Rico
description: Puerto Rico Gov. Pedro Pierluisi announced Friday that the federal government has shipped three mega generators to the Caribbean territory.

title: Maine eyes adding on-campus housing to community colleges amid enrollment boom
description: Maine legislators are considering the addition of on-campus housing to the state's seven community colleges amid a sizeable enrollment spike.

title: ‘View’ host mocked for saying she hasn't gone grocery shopping in years due to COVID: ‘Please get help'
description: Twitter users slammed "The View" host Sunny Hostin for claiming that she hasn't visited a grocery store in three years thanks to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Mississippi pedestrian fatally struck by Highway Patrol vehicle
description: A Mississippi pedestrian who was in the middle of U.S. Highway 49 was fatally struck by a Highway Patrol vehicle. The woman was hit just before 3 a.m. Friday morning.

title: Indiana woman pleads guilty in 2-year-old's fentanyl death
description: Kiara Johnson, 23, of Fort Wayne, Indiana, pleaded guilty to neglect charges after her son, 2, and daughter, 3, ingested fentanyl pills, killing the former and sickening the latter.

title: Xavier stages furious rally to beat Kennesaw State in Owls' first-ever NCAA Tournament game
description: Xavier staged a furious rally in the second half of an NCAA tournament game to beat Kennesaw State, 72-67. It was the first tournament appearance for the Owls.

title: 'Jeopardy!' host Ken Jennings remembers late Alex Trebek in unique way
description: "Jeopardy!" host Ken Jennings paid tribute to the late Alex Trebek on his social media account. Jennings shared a video of a Lego model of the "Jeopardy!" set, which included Trebek.

title: Detroit armed robber shot in chest by concealed carry permit holder after threatening to kill friend: police
description: A Detroit man was shot in the chest and arrested after trying to rob a man at gunpoint who ended up having a concealed carry permit and firing back during the robbery.

title: Newsom makes abrupt reversal after tough talk on Big Oil
description: Democratic California Gov. Gavin Newsom replaced his proposal to implement a price gouging tax targeting oil companies with a new version creating a new watchdog agency.

title: Michigan State pulls away in second half over USC to advance in March Madness
description: The Michigan State Spartans advanced to the second round of the NCAA men's basketball tournament with their victory over USC on Friday afternoon.

title: Trump Jr. accuses Biden of using TiKTok as scapegoat to distract from family's ties to China
description: Donald Trump Jr. accused President Biden of using TikTok as a scapegoat to distract from the Biden family’s financial ties to Chinese companies that have been exposed this week.

title: Manhattan DA's office 'asked for a meeting' with law enforcement ahead of possible Trump indictment
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office asked for a meeting with law enforcement ahead of a possible indictment of former President Donald Trump next week, a court source said.

title: Experts hail Florida's passage of expanded school choice legislation: ‘No longer hostage to broken system’
description: School choice activists praised a new Florida universal school choice bill which expands scholarships by eliminating the income cap for families to apply.

title: Wild custom Tesla can drive upside down
description: A YouTube channel built a Tesla with custom 10-foot-tall wheels to see if the electric sedan could be driven upside down, unlike an internal combustion engine car.

title: These Delta pilots are father and son — flying has cemented their ‘incredibly special’ bond
description: Two airline pilots share a special bond — they are father and son. The pair shared details about their relationship and what makes their unique job meaningful.

title: Blues' Jordan Binnington suspended two games without pay after throwing punch at Wild's Ryan Hartman
description: The St. Louis Blues will be without goaltender Jordan Binnington for their next two games after he was suspended for punching Minnesota Wild forward Ryan Hartman in the face.

title: How to compare vacation rental home prices
description: Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson shares how you can save money and find the best vacation deals for rental homes on Airbnb, Booking.com or Vrbo using a tool called HiChee.

title: Joy Behar hits leftist censorship of ‘To Kill a Mockingbird’: 'Doesn’t only come from the right’
description: Co-host Joy Behar slammed leftist-inspired censorship of the literary classic, "To Kill a Mockingbird" during the "The View" on Friday.

title: Brooklyn jewelry store robbed for second time by armed man 'acting like he owned the place': 'Hi! I'm back'
description: A man was caught on video brazenly robbing a Brooklyn jewelry store at knifepoint, and the owner says it's the second time the same man has robbed her since February.

title: What's the ICC that issued Putin's arrest warrant and what consequences does he face?
description: The arrest warrant will mainly serve to limit Russian President Vladimir Putin's movements and involvement in other countries, including in G20 and G8 summits.

title: Skier survives New Hampshire avalanche, found uninjured after 500-foot tumble
description: A skier in New Hampshire's White Mountains survived an avalanche uninjured, after being swept down a 500-foot gully and buried in snow for about six-and-a-half minutes.

title: New Jersey congressman rebukes green energy company for ignoring whale deaths
description: New Jersey Rep. Jeff Van Drew sharply criticized a green energy company for declining to attend a hearing he hosted Thursday about the impact of offshore wind on marine life.

title: Vehicle crash on Interstate 90 in Washington kills 3
description: Three people have been killed in a vehicle crash Thursday on Interstate 90 in Washington. Eastbound I-90 was closed into Thursday afternoon due to the severity of the fatal crash.

title: Georgia white supremacist sentenced to 20 years in convenience store shooting
description: A Georgia man who hoped a gunshot would kill Arab and Black people has been sentenced to 20 years in prison. The man pleaded guilty to a federal hate crime charge.

title: Syrian Kurdish force loses 9 fighters in 2 Iraq helicopter crashes
description: The Syrian Kurdish force in northeastern Syria lost nine fighters in two Iraq helicopters crashes this week. The group was flying the helicopters during bad weather while en route.

title: Google issues warning about remotely exploitable flaws in Android phones
description: Google issued a warning to device and auto users about vulnerabilities found in certain Samsung chips including in dozens of Android devices, wearables and vehicles.

title: Alabama prison plan will continue despite $300M cost jump
description: Alabama lawmakers planning to build two super-sized prisons will continue with the project, despite a cost increase of $300M. The estimated cost of the first prison is nearly $1 billion.

title: 4 Honolulu police officers charged after alleged coverup in police chase
description: Four Honolulu police officers have been charged after an alleged cover-up in a high-speed chase. The chase led to a driver of another car having a traumatic brain injury.

title: 'Amazon snake cat' photo seemingly fools internet users after going viral on social media
description: A photo of a supposed "Amazon cat snake" has gone viral on social media and some people appear to believe the scale-patterned yellow- and navy-furred cat is a real rare species.

title: Ohio school district switching to four-day school week: ‘We’re burnt out’
description: North College Hill City school district in Ohio is switching to a four-day school week to save teachers and students from stress and burnout.

title: Vaccine-derived poliovirus detected in Burundi, Congo
description: The detections are significant as they are the first linked with the use of a new vaccine, the novel oral poliomyelitis vaccine type 2, which was developed to reduce this risk.

title: GOP to fight back against Biden’s ‘war on energy’ in key vote this month
description: House Republicans have teed up a vote for March on legislation aimed at reversing the Biden administration's energy policies, which they say are leading to energy insecurity.

title: Massachusetts man plotted $10K murder-for-hire scheme to kill wife, prosecutors say
description: Massimo Marenghi, 56, of Malden, Massachusetts, pleaded guilty to trying to hire a contact killer to murder his wife, federal prosecutors say.

title: Biden 'anti-growth' policies will slash Medicare, Social Security tax revenue by $400-$900 billion: report
description: President Biden's policies will take away hundreds of billions of dollars promised to seniors through Social Security and Medicare, according to a new report.

title: Florida moves one step closer to universal school choice
description: The Florida House of Representatives passed a bill expanding school choice vouchers for qualified students by removing income caps on all families with kids K-12.

title: Alex Murdaugh fallout: mother of dead Buster Murdaugh classmate Stephen Smith to exhume body
description: The mother of Stephen Smith, Buster Murdaugh's high school classmate who died in 2015 near the Murdaughs' hunting estate, says she has raised enough money to exhume her son's body.

title: Minnesota regulators monitor 400,000-gallon radioactive water leak cleanup
description: Minnesota regulators said that they are monitoring cleanup efforts by utility Xcel Energy following a leak of 400,000 gallons of radioactive water from its nuclear power plant.

title: Alabama-Texas A&M-Corpus Christi game ends with wild bad beat in bettors' nightmare scenario
description: The Alabama Crimson Tide won their opening game of the NCAA Tournament, but Texas A&M-Corpus Christi nailed a three-pointer as time expired to cover the spread.

title: House lawmakers focus on 'outcompeting China' in bipartisan visit to Guyana
description: Guyana was the last stop in House lawmakers' three-country tour to bolster U.S. relations with South and Latin America, after visits to Mexico and Ecuador.

title: Hatchet-wielding attacker subdued during wild attack caught on camera at California gym
description: John Keene shares how he jumped into action with three other gym-goers to pin down an armed attacker at a California Planet Fitness before police arrived.

title: Eric Adams wants NYC to be 'place of God' after predecessor targeted religion throughout pandemic
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams called on residents to transform the city into "a place of God," showing a contrast with his predecessor who imposed restrictions on religious gatherings.

title: Rep. Fitzpatrick introduces bill to make St. Patrick's Day a federal holiday
description: Pennsylvania GOP Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick took to the floor on Friday to introduce a bill to make St. Patrick's Day a federal holiday.

title: Minnesota elementary school music teacher claims 'the goal' is to confuse students about gender: video
description: Social media is abuzz with reactions to a viral video of an elementary school teacher explaining that 'the goal' of their self-presentation is to confuse children about gender.

title: Review: The 2023 Cadillac CT4-V is a semi-autonomous American sport sedan
description: The 2023 Cadillac CT4-V is a compact sport sedan that can be equipped with the Super Cruise hands-free highway driving system, which works on 400,000 miles of roads.

title: Kentucky deputy, armed suspect both injured in exchange of gunfire
description: A Kentucky deputy who was pursuing an armed suspect was injured in an exchange of gunfire. The suspect was also wounded. They were both taken to the hospital for treatment.

title: US pledges to help Venezuelans with humanitarian project spending of $171 million
description: The U.S. pledged more than $171 million in humanitarian projects to assist Venezuelans facing food, water, and other challenges caused by the country’s political and economic crisis.

title: Latina mom fights Texas school over 'seducing hooker' game played with middle-school students
description: A Texas mom pulled her student out of KIPP Poder Middle School after a teacher asked students to pose as "seducing hookers" for an adult version of Rock, Paper, Scissor.

title: North Carolina Senate approves bill that will reduce wait-time for permit holders to drive unsupervised
description: In a bill passed by the North Carolina Senate, permit holders won't have to wait as long before they can drive unsupervised. The waiting period may be reduced from 12 to six months.

title: Russian energy firm helping China’s nuclear weapons program is ‘direct threat’ to US, GOP warns
description: Republicans are calling on Biden officials to block a Russian state-owned energy company from aiding China in its expansion of its nuclear weapons program.

title: Florida man held masseuse at gunpoint and demanded sex acts: Police
description: Timothy Paul Taylor, 35, who's been arrested over 20 times and convicted of nine felonies, allegedly held a Florida masseuse at gunpoint and demanded sex acts.

title: Crying Utah State cheerleader goes viral for heartbreaking reaction to Aggies’ first round exit
description: Utah State fans unsurprisingly did not take Thursday's first round loss to Missouri well, but one cheerleader is going viral after her reaction was caught on the game’s broadcast.

description: The Fox News Entertainment newsletter brings you the latest Hollywood headlines, celebrity interviews and stories from Los Angeles and beyond.

title: Prince Harry asks court to rule in his favor in defamation lawsuit against tabloid
description: Prince Harry has sued the Mail on Sunday publisher for defamation over a story about the Duke of Sussex's battle for security in the United Kingdom.

title: California transforming San Quentin State Prison with emphasis on rehabilitation
description: California officials announced on Thursday that the Bay Area's San Quentin State Prison will undergo a transformation focused on rehabilitation and education.

title: Gov. Newsom roasted for plan to build tiny houses for homeless: 'He has ruined California'
description: Dave Rubin rips Gov. Gavin Newsom for his failed plans to eliminate homelessness as California plans to spend $30 million to build 1,2000 small homes to address the crisis.

description: Pop culture icon Paris Hilton admitted she broke down in tears after her photo was on the cover of Playboy against her wishes, amid the release of her sex tape.

title: Spain enters period of long-term drought, likely to face another year of heatwaves, forest fires
description: Spain is expecting another year of heatwaves and forest fires after officially entering a period of long-term drought. The country is geographically prone to high temperatures.

title: Bill mandating North Carolina colleges to take US studies class to graduate approved by state House
description: The North Carolina House has approved a bill requiring state college students to take a U.S. history or government class in order to graduate.

title: House Oversight seeks testimony from Hunter Biden partner who transferred $1M to Biden family
description: The House Oversight Committee is requesting Hunter Biden’s business associate Rob Walker testify before the panel on transfers of money to the Biden family.

description: Senate Republicans are pushing the upper chamber to hold hearings and conduct oversight of the incident in which a Russian plane downed a U.S. drone over the Black Sea.

title: Is Joe Rogan's Comedy Mothership good for comedy? Attendees weigh in
description: Attendees of Joe Rogan's new Comedy Mothership shows in Austin, Texas, shared whether they think the anti-woke venue is good for the state of stand-up comedy.

description: Rep. Chip Roy hinted at the idea of defunding Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen in a recent tweet, after she said she could not negotiate with Republicans on raising the debt ceiling.

title: Biden refuses to take questions with Irish leader after WH defends not holding press conference
description: President Biden did not take questions from reporters after a meeting with Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar, despite the White House earlier insisting that he would answer press questions.

description: Friends of Maggie Murdaugh, Alex Murdaugh's deceased wife, are speaking out after the disgraced South Carolina lawyer was found guilty of her 2021 murder.

title: Vintage Pyrex bowls may be worth big bucks as collectors hunt high and low for nostalgic dishes
description: Your favorite vintage Pyrex dish may be worth more than you think these days, as these traditional pieces of glassware and storage containers sell for upward of $2,000 online.

description: CNN Chief Medical Correspondent Sanjay Gupta agreed with the claim that selfie filters on phones perpetuate racial bias by making users look more "Eurocentric."

description: Drew Barrymore had a big reaction after her old co-star Hugh Grant referred to her singing in their 2007 movie "Music and Lyrics" as "horrendous."

title: German Cabinet minister will make official visit to Taiwan next week for first time since 1997
description: German Education Minister Bettina Stark-Watzinger will travel to Taiwan next week. This is the first high-level visit by a German official in 26 years.

title: Marianne Williamson charges report alleging abusive behavior during 2020 campaign is ‘hit piece’
description: Democratic presidential candidate Marianne Williamson claims that a report that she verbally abused campaign staffers during her 2020 White House run is a “hit piece.”

title: International Criminal Court issues Putin arrest warrant over child deportations from Ukraine
description: The International Criminal Court has issued an arrest warrant for Russian President Vladimir Putin, citing his alleged involvement in the abduction of Ukrainian children

title: NYT stands by report Alabama’s Kai Spears was present at fatal January shooting despite denials
description: Alabama's Kai Spears denied a report from the New York Times that he was present during a fatal January shooting, but the outlet continues to stand by its reporting.

title: US grants $2.4 million on cloud seeding for Colorado River basin to enhance rainfall as a water resource
description: The Southern Nevada Water Authority will accept a $2.4 million federal grant to fund cloud seeding near the Colorado River to enhance rainfall as a water resource for the desert region.

title: Senator, former combat pilot says it’s not just Russian aggression that caused midair crash
description: Russia has denied that one of its planes in any way made contact with the U.S. drone, but Russia's defense minister reportedly rewarded the pilots for defending their airspace.

title: European legal team wraps up questioning of Lebanon's Central Bank chief in Beirut
description: The questioning period in the investigation into Riad Salameh, the chief of Lebanon's Central Bank, has been wrapped up. Salameh has been the central bank chief since 1993.

title: Greece announces increase in country's minimum wage that will restore pay to pre-bailout levels
description: Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis announced that Greece is raising its minimum wage to levels existing before the international bailout that occurred over a decade ago.

description: Speaker of the House Kevin McCarthy joined "Fox & Friends" to discuss Democrats skipping a hearing at the southern border and says they are ignoring the crisis they created.

title: Senate Republicans approve Kentucky bill to legalize medical marijuana in breakthrough endorsement
description: After years of rejecting cannabis access for people suffering from debilitating illnesses, the Kentucky Senate voted to approve a bill legalizing medical marijuana.

title: California bill protects doctors who mail abortion pills to out-of-state patients
description: New California legislation would protect doctors who mail abortion pills to patients in other states, as well as those who mail contraceptives and transgender-related medications.
